headline: Suzy's Mashed Red Potatoes
description: This easy red mashed potatoes recipe uses butter, milk, and sour cream for extra creaminess. Red potato skins are full of flavor and well worth a try!

video.description: Rustic, dreamy and creamy mashed red potatoes.
video.name: Suzy's Mashed Red Potatoes

name: Suzy's Mashed Red Potatoes

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add potatoes, and cook until tender but still firm, about 10 minutes; drain.
Transfer potatoes to a large bowl; add butter, milk, sour cream, salt, and pepper. Mash together until smooth and creamy.

review.reviewBody: These are my go to mashed potatoes. Follow the recipe exactly just add some liquid crab boil for some heat..delicious!!

Terrific taste and texture, paired with Guinness Beef Stew recipe the combination is phenominal. My suggestion is to hold back 10% of the liquid and add as required to make the Mash consistency that you prefer.
Suzy’s (not garlic, not onion, not rosemary, etc.) mashed red potatoes were good as is! Thank you for sharing.

Basic, easy & tasty for 6, rather than 8. I feel it could be just as tasty with WAY less butter. 4-stars because the recipe calls for a STICK of butter, where most call for a few tablespoons. Try it with less.
So simple, but so creamy and tasty!
I have a zillion recipes for mashed potatoes — this is the easiest and best I’ve tried .
Delicious!

I thought these were pretty good. I had to cook them quite a bit longer than recommended, but I think that might be because of my potatoes, not the recipe. I love little additions that reviewers add to recipes, but I made these the same as the recipe says. The base, without salt or pepper, is a bit bland (of course), so I added quite a bit of each, and, because I still thought something was missing, I added some garlic powder (in lieu of the real stuff) to my helping (other's don't like garlic, so the rest is still unseasoned in that regard). Thus, I think these are pretty good mashed potatoes, but not the best because of the lack of garlic. One might also want to heat up the cold ingredients before mixing together.
Simple to make and very delicious!
These are my absolute favorite potatoes. Just make as is!

Delicious and super easy! Served with the Easy Meatloaf recipe, some cornbread and pinto beans. My husband and nephew LOVED it! Didn’t change a thing, made these exactly like the recipe. Will definitely be making again!

Delicious! This is a simple and tasty recipe. Turned out great for my first time making mashed potatoes from scratch!

Tweaks:
I scaled the recipe up for 5 pounds of potatoes, and the ratios for the butter and sour cream were spot on still. I was hesitant to put that much milk in as I like my potatoes nice and thick so I added it a little at a time, and I only used about 2/3 cup of milk (recipe ratio would have been 1.25 cups) so that's one of those things that doesn't scale linearly. I also scaled up the time that I cooked the potatoes to 30 minutes as I had a lot more potatoes to cook and some of them were kind of large.
This was so easy and delicious. Loved by all tonight!
Delicious Great recipe.
I followed the recipe exactly and they came out perfectly and were a huge hit with the family. Thank you.
Delicious, reminded me of the potatoes my mom makes. The skins make it that much better. May top it with bacon bits next time cooking this recipe.
Loved them but would use 1/2 the milk & butter next time, they were a bit on the runny side even after a bit more heat afterwards.
Great mashed potato recipe. People love it!
Love it!

I tried to make it exactly as called for,
except that I had to use full fat Greek yogurt because I didn't have any sour cream. 
I also had 3 pounds of potatoes, so I scaled the recipe up. 

We found it to be just a teeny bit too rich for us, which is easily solvable by adding a bit less butter next time. This is a personal preference, not a flaw in the recipe. Keeping in mind also that I did use high quality unsalted Irish butter, so maybe that bumped up the richness factor. I salted my potato water generously and also added some salt near the end to taste. less than 1/2 tsp probably.
Added garlic powder. DELISH!

Actually I loved this receipe! I gave it a 4 because it changed it a bit. I didn't have any sour cream so I warmed 1/2 cup of lite house ranch and 1/2 cup of milk instead + the butter, salt and pepper. I used my kitchen aid with the paddle and added the warmed liquid until I liked the consistancy. I do enjoy to read others additions or changes. Thanks for this receipe!
Outstanding way to make quick mashed potatoes. MUCH better than box mix.
Super quick and very tasty!!
These are the best!! I make them frequently for my kids and family and they love them each and every time. The only change I make is to add about a teaspoon of minced garlic. Viola , perfection.
Super easy and delicious even dairy free. I followed the recipe and used dairy free butter substitute, almond milk and dairy free sour cream!

This was a great recipe, except you need to add more salt , cut the potatoes in half , add a pinch of pepper, add a little garlic, and don’t use butter. On second though, find another recipe You have to change to many things to make it good. Also, it isn’t good with steak either. Unless you: grill the steak to a medium rare and don’t use this recipe. Bake a potato instead
Absolutely the BEST mashed potatoes ever! Everyone was begging for this recipe after they tried it at a family dinner, have these on the menu for Thanksgiving Day dinner.
Good mash.
Super easy and absolutely fantastic!!!

I followed other user recommendations and heated the mix-ins before adding to the smashed potatoes. I also added chopped garlic. Next time I make them I will sauté the garlic in the butter to soften a bit. The potatoes were very creamy and delicious. Will definitely add to my side dish rotation.
Very good recipe. No adjustments were made. Simple recipe using whole ingredients.
Great recipe! They went perfectly with pork tenderloin.

This recipe was delicious and the potatoes were so creamy. They went perfectly with the meatloaf that I made and were a big hit. Next time I will add garlic since that's my preference, but they don't need anything because they are delicious as is!
Very good recipe but I needed to double the boiling time recommended to get the potatoes soft enough to mash.

I think it's quite delish! I wouldn't change any of the ingredients. We're having them for supper shortly.
I don't a 'masher'; so, improvised with our two-beater mixer!
Omg these were so good!!! So simple and delicious. I didn’t change a thing.
Delicious! I did not peel potatoes.
Made it as is the first time. Came out fantastic. The second time I added some granulated garlic. That’s it. It’s fantastic as is, though — I’m just a garlic nut.
Simple and delicious. This is an easy go to recipe and a good base if you want to improvise.
Made these potatoes as a side dish to venison steaks, it was a perfect addition! Delicious!
Absolutely delicious!!!
These were some of the best mashed potatoes I have ever had! I didn’t know mashed potatoes could taste so good! I followed the recipe exactly and they were delicious! This recipe is a keeper!

Delicious! Used the recipe almost as written. Only change was 3 cloves of garlic boiled and mashed with the taters. (I had a hankering for garlic potatoes the night I made this recipe but I did not add due to a deficiency in the recipe). Just a great recipe and so time friendly for getting dinner on the table after work. Thanks!
So easy and delicious! I didn't have sour cream on hand so I used yogurt and it worked out really well. So creamy!
Delicious
My go-to recipe. I don't change a thing, and they're perfect every time. Thanks Suzy!
Excellent as written except I added a tad more milk, and more sour cream... thank u for the simply tasteful recipe!
Best mashed potatoes I’ve ever had. I substituted the sour cream with a Mexican 4 cheese blend and added 2 cloves of finely chopped garlic.
made this many times as written, no changes. Awesome!
I made this with no modifications and it was great.
I have made these about 50 times since first finding this recipe. Everyone always tells me how great they are, and has second helpings. This recipe is perfection!

I'm 30 years old! I love cooking, especially for other people. I enjoy watching people eat the things I've made for them. My father and law also likes cooking. We enjoy finding and making new recipes and then sharing them with each other. We each have a binder that we keep recipes, that we each deemed worthy to make again, and again. Its funny that after all the recipes I've tried I had never made home made mashed potatoes.I know right!! This recipe was my first. This recipe was also the first that I had finally decided to sign up for an account with allrecipes.com, as well as my first food review. This recipe was great! It was easy, and I took a few recommendations from other reviewers, such as heating the milk, butter, and sour cream before adding to the potatoes, and I also added some minced garlic and garnished with chives! I'll never buy instant potatoes again!!!
These actually came out very good! I was concerned at first that they would be too runny. After they cooled a little bit they were perfect! My family loved them.
These are absolutely perfect! I do add 1/3 cup of sour cream vs the 1/4; however, I love the taste of sour cream!
just like momma
A little too much sour cream. I would cut it in half or omit all together
It was great! No changes needed!
Made the recipe exactly as written. Delicious, creamy and the flavor is just right. A new go-to recipe for me!
Sauteed some chopped garlic in a portion of the butter. Excellent recipe!

Delicious! Did not have any sour creme at hand so I adapted it. Mixed milk, butter, rosemary, garlic, salt and pepper in a small pan over low heat till the butter melted then folded it into the potatoes. WATER MUST BE BOILING BEFORE YOU ADD POTATOES IN! Don’t overcook them.

Best mashed potatoes ever! I followed the recipe as is. Amazing flavor. I had trouble sleeping and I couldn't stop thinking about these potatoes. Had a midnight snack of more. I will be making these again!
So creamy!! Taste amazing!!! Best mash potatoes!!!
This was a nice change from the eastern potatoes I usually use. I added more milk maybe because I used 2-1/2# of potatoes. Great to have to peel!

When made with the quantities listed, it was too liquid for my taste. After combining everything, I cooked it a bit more on low heat to evaporate some of the liquid and thicken things up. Still not quite my style; I prefer a more “fluffy” mashed potato, which this was not, but at least it salvaged the side for us. Probably won’t make again, as I have other mashed potato recipes I like more.

Wonderful...these are definitely going to become my quick and easy alternative to mashed potatoes because these do not need peeling! That said, the dish was excellent. The only change I made was to add a tiny bit of garlic.
I fixed this with BBQ ribs and pan—steamed asparagus for a delicious meal!
Did exactly as recipe called for and loved it

This is a great recipe as is. The only thing I do differently is use chicken stock instead of water. If chicken stock isn’t on hand, then boil the water and add a few boullion cubes or better than boullion mix to the water and mix it in before adding the potatoes. It makes for more depth of flavor instead of just salting the water.
Just incredible! We just love the great taste. Thank you

Stellar!!! I have made these potatoes so many times since finding this recipe!!! The only thing I add is 1 or 2 cloves of minced garlic, and it takes it to the next level!!! I would recommend, while the potatoes are boiling, to heat all other ingredients together in a bowl in the microwave or on the stovetop, so that when they’re added to the potatoes, everything stays nice and hot!! We love these, thanks for the wonderful recipe!!
Made as directed and they were great! Definitely how I’m making them from now on.
I consider it the only way to make mashed potatoes now. People always comment how tasty they are! No substitutions.
This is a great recipe!!! It was a hit tonight for Christmas Dinner!!
This is easy to make and delicious!!!

My husband loved this, and he’s really into mashed potatoes!! I found it just a tad bland, but could be Bc I didn’t use enough salt. It was very easy and fast to make! Will def make again!! Great easy way to have natural mash potatoes!
It was delish! Of course after I added the main ingredients, I improvised according to my taste buds. My husband and son loved it. I will definitely be making these again!

These are my go to mashed potatoes for any occasion, but especially Thanksgiving. I don't really measure the ingredients anymore and I also add garlic powder. My eldest and her husband have a standing argument on whose mom makes the best mashed potatoes - its based on these. (They are hands down my other son-in-laws favorites)

Good old fashion recipe that is easy and has a nice potato flavor. I look for recipes that have minimal ingredients because I don’t have anything fancy in my kitchen. This fits the bill. Thanks, I’m pairing it with a pot roast and looking forward to it!
This is the best recipe for mashed potatoes!! I absolutely love them with sour cream.
Made as is, and it was delicious!
Tasted good- seemed a bit thin.
These are just okay. Next time, I will add cheese.

I made this when we hadn't gone grocery shopping yet and everyone loved it. I just substituted cream cheese for sour cream because I didn't have any. Paired well with lemon garlic chicken. I'll try sour cream next time.
Delicious
These are ALWAYS a hit! We love these (and I'm wondering why I don't make them more often?!
I made these tonight. I halved the recipe. Just two of us. Added a little garlic, salt and pepper. Yummy!

Love this recipe! It’s my go to for mashed potatoes. The only thing I do differently is add a few cloves of garlic! Also, when I have it, I boil half water and half chicken broth to cook the potatoes in. I learned this trick when making any mashed potato recipe and it adds just a little flavor that’s amazing!
I added a Lil Garlic Sea Salt. This Recipe is Awesome. This will be my Go To Mashed Potatoes recipe from now on.
These were really good! Gave it 4 stars only because I added garlic and a little more butter and sour cream than called for.
I just loved it and everyone else did also!
No changes and will definitely make again.

I have made this recipe for years ….. and oddly MY name is SUZY …. I do not use the milk, don’t need it with the sour cream, but I do use a little of the potatoe water for moisture. And all important I add a healthy amount of Parmesean cheese stirred in at the end along with more butter. G R E A T …. Occassionally I add loose frozen spinach when I drain the potatoes …… GREAT AGAIN.
I always made mashed potatoes like this without the milk but with more sour cream. Love it.
These were really good! Added in some rosemary and a little bit of cheese for more flavor. Will probably add a bit more milk next time to make it a little more creamy. Otherwise, no complaints!
What an easy way to make mashed potatoes. This recipe paired perfectly with my steaks (see Blake’s Best Steaks) and steamed broccoli!
It was delicious!!!
Light, creamy and delicious!! I added some minced garlic to the water while cooking the potatoes to give them a little garlic flavor. Such a easy delicious recipe!!

I cooked these as directed and we think they are delicious with pot roast and roasted parmesan asparagus. Standing alone they are a bit bland but I'll try adding garlic when they will be accompanying chicken. Many thanks for a delish recipe!
